comments: a(n) is the number of ways to partition the set {1,2,...,2n} into an even number of odd size blocks. [From _Geoffrey Critzer_, Apr 11 2010]Unsigned sequence has e.g.f. cosh(sinh(x)) (even powers only).
references: L. Comtet, Advanced Combinatorics, Reidel, 1974, p. 226, 8th line of table.
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=0..50
formula: a(n)=sum(j=0..n, (2^(2*j+1)*sum(i=0..(n-j), (i-n+j)^(2*n)*binomial((2*n-2*j),i)*(-1)^(n-i))/(2*n-2*j)!)), n>0, a(1)=0. [From Vladimir Kruchinin, Jun 08 2011]
author: _R. H. Hardin_, _Simon Plouffe_
